text: is a Japanese professional footballer who plays as a centre-back for Urawa Red Diamonds. ==Club career== Makino with Sanfrecce Hiroshima in 2010 Makino was born in Nishi-ku, Hiroshima. In January 2012, he returned to J. League, loaned by 1. FC Köln to Urawa Red Diamonds, where he was coached again by his former Sanfrecce's coach, Mihailo Petrović. ==International career== In July 2007, Makino was elected Japan U-20 national team for 2007 U-20 World Cup. At this tournament, he played 3 matches as center back and scored a goal in the match against Czech Republic. Makino made his full international debut for Japan on 6 January 2010 in a 2011 Asian Cup qualification against Yemen.
